page.title: 08FARMING,LAND TENURE
page.content: The Crown Allotment was sold and it passed into the hands of John Christie (1774 ? - 1858) an indigo merchant of London. It has survived almost comple -tely intact as a single unit to the present day and it now represents one of the largest single farms in Britain. It is known as CNEWR ESTATES Ltd. after the farmhouse in the centre of the Crown Allotment built by Chrisitie in 1821. As part of the requirements of the Enclosure Act, he was obliged to fence in the Crown Allotment. This was done by means of dry stone walls,parts of which can still be seen today.
